reviewText: This is another way of keep on squeezing money out of the fan's pockets...For the old fans that have all the previous DVDs and CD's like me, it is totally worthless...First of all the CD's are identical, different digipak, fancy case, but same exact material (not even remastered AFAIK)...Second the DVD's are a bunch of talking material, some of them are even included in previos releases of the DVD's as bonus that I have (if not all of them, I need to double check, but for sure some of them are, as I have seen them before)...not sure what the urge in having Blackmore and Candice talking on the screen, but honestly I preffer them playing...They do have a few songs, mainly mutilated by the talkings, my question is why not including this material as a bonus in a future release rather than trying to sell it as new unseen footage???The only reason of the two stars is the price...other than that, and if you do not have the previous releases is fine...I sold mine the next day I got them...
summary: For the old fans that has the previous DVDs and Cd it is totally worthless...

reviewText: This is one of my favorite bands. This boxed set does not disappoint. The packaging is in a leather like cover that feels plush to the touch. Very elegant. The videos are wonderful and now I get to watch the band from before I found them. This is a beautiful boxed set that would make a wonderful gift for any fan, or even a nice little started box for anyone you would like to introduce to the band too. Love it!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Whether you are new to Blackmore's Night catching up with the band's back catalogue or an old hand who might enjoy watching some previously unreleased concert footage, you should find Beginning packed with great music and a solid value.Myself, I go way back with the music of Ritchie Blackmore but confess to losing track of him as Deep Purple took a sharp commercial turn. Recently a friend introduced me to Blackmore's Night and I was astounded by the variety and the quality of the music, so I ordered the one I had heard as well as this set which seemed a no-brainer. And as it turns out, it's one of the best buying decisions of the month.The remasters of the first two albums contain numerous songs I will never tire of hearing including Play Minstrel Play, Ocean Gypsy, Writing On the Wall, No Second Chance, Greensleeves, Under A Velvet Moon, Wind In the Willows, Catherine Howard's Fate, Fool's Gold, and a number of excellent instrumentals interspersed throughout. The play of Blackmore and his band is enchanting, and Night's vocals remind me in turn of Paatos' Petronella Nettermalm, Heart's Nancy Wilson, and Tish Hinojosa (that last especially on Spirit of the Sea)As for the concert DVDs, they are less complete concerts than an intermixture of songs from the stage and informal gatherings, as well as informative conversations with Blackmore and Night regarding the music. The sound quality of some of the concert footage is somewhat off, but overall the two DVDs are a very welcome and useful addition to the package.Now let's talk value. EACH of the discs is individually packaged in it's own case within the larger velvet box and each comes with a very attractive booklet filled with pictures, info, and lyrics (for the CDs) which are germane to that particular disc. Personally, I don't see how it can be sold so cheaply. I plan to buy several more to give as gifts.If you haven't heard Blackmore's Night, this is not the Ritchie Blackmore of yore. This is a Ritchie Blackmore who has taken ancient styles, modernized them, and made this experience immeasurably richer with the vocal prowess of his wife Candice Night. Get this set while it's still around and still cheap. How could you go wrong?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Don't know about you guys, but this is exactly what I want from Blackmore's Night: Medieval/Renaissance-inspired music and show with just enough of a modern edge to freshen it up some and prevent it from - as Ritchie says in the commentary - becoming a dry history lesson. At $ 15.00, this set is a no-brainer. You get their first 2 albums, plus 2 DVDs with concert- as well as off-stage and 'private' footage in very attractive packaging. I've been a little concerned about their partial departure from their Renaissance Faire roots more towards Rock & Pop, and I'm hoping this may be a sign of the band reversing that trend. We already have plenty more than enough slickly overproduced Pop and Rock acts, we don't need another one. What we do not have is a lot of 'Renaissance Rock', a genre of which Blackmore's Night may be the most shining example.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Just got my package in the mail a couple of hours ago, and must say, this is unreal! $14.99 for this beautiful package is incredible! The packaging is awesome, with a double fold package for each of the 2 CDs and 2 DVDs.. each disc comes with a beautiful booklet. I had thought for such a meager price it would be a very generic package, but this is a splendid set. I would have not been surprised if each of the first two albums had cost this much with a bonus DVD, but this is wonderful. The DVDs are wonderful.. I suspect this will sell out fast.. I hope they consider doing more of their albums this way!! KUDOS!!!
summary: Wish I could find more incredible sets like this!!

reviewText: i watched both dvds back to back, every song is beautiful and musically brilliant, candice knights voice is one of the best ive ever heard, ritchies guitar work is intricate and spiritual! the velvet box this set came in is really nice and i would recomend this to anyone who loves real music!
Title: N/A

reviewText: For the diehard BN fans, this is a good collectors item and the ability to see them in their early stages. For those who wants to get into BN, this is a very good introduction. Sound is only in stereo for the dvds but the packaging is very good and all discs come in digipak packed in a velvet box with clear pullover sleeve with all the song titles. Ritchie's playing were very energetic and Candice's vocal fresh with passion. The interviews were candid, funny and interesting. For the first dvd, I could see John O'Reilly on drums and I wonder whether the other two were Greg Smith and Paul Morris? That's the only information lacking. As a BN fan, I am happy with this package. Thumbs up!
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you don't have their first two albums, Shadow of the Moon and Under a Violet Moon, then this is worth the lower price. The DVD's are simple vid recordings from their 1997-1998 Germany tour and 2000 Castle tour. The DVD sound is a bit lacking in its quality and has a cheaper hand-held record feel to it. It's not the quality you'd see if they set out with top notch camera's and sound studio with the intention of releasing it. They are classic BN saved for posterity and given the low cost it is worth it overall.
summary: First two CD's with live performances.
Title: N/A
